title: Chicken and Noodles
instructions: Melt butter in large pot over medium heat.
Add flour, whisk until combined, and brown.
Slowly add chicken stock, whisking constantly.
Add between 2-4 cups water (2 cups will yield little to no broth, 4 cups will be more brothy like soup).
Bring to a boil, whisking frequently to keep roux from clumping.
Add noodles.
Cook according to noodle packaging, stirring occasionally, adding spices in the last minute or two.
While noodles are cooking, shred white meat from rotisserie chicken.
Stir chicken into noodles after removing from heat
Serve in bowls.

title: Al Bundy's Chili

ingredientList.prep: ribs and seeds removed and diced
ribs and seeds removed and diced

instructions: Heat a drizzle of oil in large pot over medium-high heat.
Cook garlic, onions, green peppers, and jalapeños 2-3 minutes, until fragrant and onion is translucent.
Add ground beef, chili powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, oregano, cumin, salt and pepper.
Cook until beef is browned through.
Add beef stock and crushed tomatoes and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes.
While chili simmers, bring 1 cup water to a boil in a small pot.
Add rice and remove from heat.
Serve chili over rice.

title: Broccoli Cheddar Soup

ingredientList.prep: florets only or florets and stems

instructions: Dice onion, mince garlic, and peel and cut carrots into thin slices.
In a medium pan, add 1 Tbsp butter and diced onion. Sauté over medium heat until onion is translucent and barely browned, about 4 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook about 30 seconds, stirring constantly. Remove pan from heat and set aside.
In a large pot, add remaining butter and flour and cook over medium heat for 3-5 minutes, whisking constantly, until flour is thickened.
Slowly add chicken stock, whisking constantly.
Slowly add half & half, whisking constantly.
Allow mixture to simmer over low heat for 15-20 minutes, whisking intermittently to re-incorporate skin.
After simmering 15-20 minutes, add broccoli, carrots, and onion and garlic previously set aside.
Add salt, pepper, paprika, cayenne pepper and stir to combine.
Allow to simmer over low heat for 20-25 minutes, whisking intermittently to re-incorporate skin.

While soup simmers, grate the cheese. After simmering 20-25 minutes, add most of the cheese, reserving a small amount for garnishing if desired. Stir in cheese until melted and fully incorporated, about 1 minute.
Transfer to bowls and serve.
